title: Four-year-old girl accidentally shoots her mother in leg
content:
A rural Owensville woman was accidentally shot Dec. 22 and wounded in the leg when her nearly 4-year-old daughter discharged a .40 cal. handgun in their residence off of Route Y. Gasconade County Sheriff Randy Esphorst said the young girl “got access to the loaded handgun, pointed it at her mother, and pulled the trigger.”
Esphorst said the round struck the woman in the leg and exited her body.
“It was through-and-through the leg, it went through a wall, and hit a concrete wall where the round disintegrated,” said Esphorst.
Sheriff’s Sgt. Scott Eiler said the incident was reported at 7:46 p.m. Thursday as an “accidental discharge of a firearm.”
Owensville Area Ambulance District personnel transported the 27-year-old woman to Mercy Hospital Washington with a gunshot wounded to her right thigh, according to Eiler. The bullet also passed through a vanity in the corner of a room before going through a wall and into an exterior concrete wall.
“Everbody was lucky,” said Eiler. “It could have been a lot worse.”
The woman’s name was not released. Eiler said a report was being finalized Tuesday afternoon and would be submitted to Gasconade County Prosecuting Attorney Mary Weston for her review of possible charges. Eiler said the Family Services Division was also notified of the incident.
“They have contacted the family and have conducted their investigation,” said Eiler. “It’s still an ongoing investigation with them.”
